explanation.rules:
1. Word order.
(O) V-Is (S = subject; O = object; V = predicate).
(O1) V1-I=S (O2) V2-Is.
(O1) V1-Is1-a (O2) V2-Is2 (S1 != S2).
N1-a N2-a, 'N1 and N2' (N = noun).
before a vowel, b becomes w.
In some verbs, the vowel in the last syllable of the root assimilates to the vowel of the first syllable of the ending.
Suffixes: (The suffixes are listed by subject. I=S is the infix for same-subject constructions. Is is the suffix for the second verb, divided by tense.)
* 1st person sg - I=S (S1 = S2): -en-i; Is: past -aan, present -iin, future -an-iin.
* 2nd person sg - I=S (S1 = S2): -en-eb; Is: past -eeb, present -eeb, future -an-eeb.
* 3rd person sg m - I=S (S1 = S2): -en-e; Is: past -oon, present -een, future -an-een.
* 3rd person sg f - I=S (S1 = S2): -en-u; Is: past -een, present -uum, future -an-uun.
* 1st person pl - I=S (S1 = S2): -en-ub; Is: past -uub, present -uub, future -an-uub.
* 3rd person pl - I=S (S1 = S2): -en-ib; Is: past -iib, present -iib, future -an-iib.
